Title.evidence: Evaluation of Carotid Artery Stenting Without Embolic Protection Devices in Yemen: A Retrospective Cohort Study

Trial_Design.evidence: This retrospective cohort study was conducted at Borg Al-Atiba and American Modern Hospital in Aden, Yemen, from March 2023 to March 2025.

Participants.evidence: Participants included 62 patients with symptomatic carotid artery stenosis, confirmed by duplex ultrasound or CTA and DSA.

Intervention.evidence: All procedures were performed by a single interventional neurologist using closed-cell Carotid WALLSTENTs.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the occurrence of 30-day periprocedural complications, including mortality, stroke, myocardial infarction, or arrhythmia.

Number_Analysed.evidence: The study included 62 patients (53 males, mean age 60.2 ± 9.7 years).

Result_Outcome.evidence: The technical success rate was 100%, with no perioperative cerebral infarctions.

Harms.evidence: One patient developed transient dysarthria, and two experienced significant bradycardia, which responded to atropine. Three patients had mild local hematoma, and one had a femoral pseudoaneurysm.
